Name: Soles
Description: The ancient egyptians used the leaves of the palm and of reed for weaving sandals. They generally laid two or three soles one on top of the other and reinforced them by a simple reed. The Brussels piece is a lovely example of a right sole of which the edge has been finished with a double reed. The straps, which were fixed by a knot formed under the sole, have not been preserved. The piece dates from the Ptolemaic Period.
